messages.content: Hi, I'm having trouble installing dbatools. Can you help?
Of course! To install dbatools, you can run 'Install-Module -Name dbatools' in your PowerShell console. Make sure to run as admin.
I got an error saying 'no match was found for the specified search criteria and module name dbatools'.
Ah, that usually happens if the PSGallery isn't trusted. Try running 'Set-PSRepository -Name PSGallery -InstallationPolicy Trusted' and then try the install command again.
It worked, thanks! How do I backup a SQL database with dbatools?
You're welcome! To backup a SQL database, you can use 'Backup-DbaDatabase'. For example, 'Backup-DbaDatabase -SqlInstance YourInstance -Database YourDatabase -BackupDirectory YourBackupDir'.
Is there a way to schedule these backups?

Yes, you can use SQL Agent and dbatools. Check out https://dbatools.io/agent. But we actually recommend Ola Hallengren's scripts and have a few commands to support installing them even in offline environments.
Awesome, you've been a big help!
Glad I could assist! If you have any more questions about dbatools, feel free to ask. Have a great day!
